name: Math.round(x)
content: Some apps need to know how to round a number to the nearest integer. The tie-breaking rule for half-way numbers (ending in ".5") is to round them up to the next largest integer.

examples.name: Example: Typical usage
Example: Floor
examples.description: Uses arithmetic and round() to round a number down to the next smallest integer.

return_value: A number representing the integer nearest to x, or NaN if x is not a number or no parameter is provided.
short_description: Returns the number rounded to the nearest integer.
